programme.title: FL v. Dalia Dippolito
programme.desc: Jurors hear from the potential victim himself; days before she was arrested, Dalia got her husband to agree to take his name off the deed to their home.

programme.title: FL v. Dalia Dippolito
programme.desc: The defense tried to challenge Michael Dippolito by questioning his credibility; Dalia's attorney focused on his criminal past of fraud and scams.

programme.title: Pilot Triple Murder Trial
programme.desc: Lieutenant Leonard Smith is pushing back against the defense's allegation that police only singled out Kit Martin as a suspect, so they could make an arrest in a three-year-old cold case; the jury listens to testimony from a crime scene photographer.

programme.title: Pilot Triple Murder Trial
programme.sub-title: The Body Found In The Cellar
programme.desc: Prosecutors present the jury with detailed, yet graphic photos of the body of Calvin Phillips; he was one of three victims in this case; prosecutors claim he was the target of a murder plot and the others were at the wrong place at the wrong time.

programme.title: Pilot Triple Murder Trial
programme.desc: The crime scene photographer answers questions under cross-examination in Kentucky versus Kit Martin; multiple law enforcement agencies look into the deaths of Kit Martin's three neighbors.

programme.title: Pilot Triple Murder Trial
programme.desc: The jury sees crime scene photos showing blood drops, a shell casing and a pistol in a yard; the state wanted to prove that all of this linked the defendant to the murders of Calvin and Pamela Phillips and Edward Dansereau.

programme.title: Pilot Triple Murder Trial
programme.desc: A third paramedic takes the stand; prosecutors try to show that the defendant plotted and carried out the murder of his three neighbors on the same day; prosecutors are not done bringing in law enforcement officers to testify.

programme.title: Pilot Triple Murder Trial
programme.desc: The Sheriff's Department calls on SWAT to help get inside Kit Martin's home after the deaths of his three neighbors; an investigator from that department claims his officers needed to be safe because of the defendant's military background.

programme.title: Killer Or Cover-Up Murder Trial
programme.desc: Paramedics recall their interactions with Karen Read, who attempted to perform CPR on O'Keefe; Karen Read's lawyers accuse a paramedic of perjury.

programme.title: Killer Or Cover-Up Murder Trial
programme.sub-title: The Lieutenant and the Leaf Blower
programme.desc: The highest-ranking police officer, who came to the scene where the victim's body was found, takes the stand; Lieutenant Paul Gallagher recalls what he did when he got there.

programme.title: Killer Or Cover-Up Murder Trial
programme.desc: Jurors listens to more testimony from the highest-ranking officer who arrived at the scene where Boston PD veteran, John O'Keefe, was found unresponsive; lieutenant Paul Gallagher recalls the early days of the murder investigation.

programme.title: Killer Or Cover-Up Murder Trial
programme.desc: Karen Read's defense drills a Canton police lieutenant on the stand during cross-examination; lieutenant Paul Gallagher tells jurors that there was blood-stained snow and a broken cocktail glass where John O'Keefe was found in the snowbank.

programme.title: Killer Or Cover-Up Murder Trial
programme.sub-title: Dash Cam Footage of the Crime Scene
programme.desc: Prosecutors call in a Canton police sergeant who arrived at the crime scene that morning where John O'Keefe was found unconscious in the snow; a visual description of the crime scene where O'Keefe's body is told by Sergeant Sean Goode on the stand.

programme.title: Killer Or Cover-Up Murder Trial
programme.sub-title: Working a Crime Scene in Blizzard Conditions
programme.desc: The police officers who showed up at the crime scene recall how investigators had to improvise during blizzard conditions that morning; plastic party cups and a leaf blower were tools law enforcement used to retrieve key evidence.

programme.title: Accomplice to Murder, With Vinnie Politan
programme.sub-title: GA v. Crowder & Stanton - The Tomato Patch Murder
programme.desc: Sixty-four-year-old Thurman Martin ruled his family with an iron fist, brutally beating anyone who dared stand up to his emotional and physical abuse. Then one day he vanished, his family telling police he'd left with just a few changes of clothing.

programme.title: Accomplice to Murder, With Vinnie Politan
programme.sub-title: KY v. Monroe - Bourbon, Bullets, And Betrayal
programme.desc: Vicki and Gerald Monroe's dream of owning and operating a Louisville bar together came to a tragic end when Vicki found her husband shot dead and the cash register emptied in an apparent robbery.

programme.title: Accomplice to Murder, With Vinnie Politan
programme.sub-title: FL v. Malarik - The Winn Dixie Murder
programme.desc: When Sherri Malarik is found dead in a Winn-Dixie parking lot, police suspect her husband Greg is involved; but it takes twenty years and the confession of his accomplice and former lover Jennifer Spohn to finally charge him with murder.

programme.title: Accomplice to Murder, With Vinnie Politan
programme.sub-title: FL v. Larzelere :The Root of Evil
programme.desc: After a masked man shot dentist Norman Larzelere who dies in the arms of his hysterical wife Virginia, police initially suspect a robbery gone wrong; a friend of Virginia's oldest son Jason reveals a twisted plot.

programme.title: FL v. Dalia Dippolito
programme.desc: The jury weighed the credibility of the state's key witness, Michael Dippolito, the defendant's husband.

programme.title: FL v. Dalia Dippolito
programme.desc: The Defense challenged Michael's credibility and tried to argue that Michael had a manipulative role in this alleged murder-for-hire plot.

programme.title: FL v. Dalia Dippolito
programme.desc: The jury heard details about the cash flow during Dalia and Michael Dippolito's relationship.

programme.title: FL v. Dalia Dippolito
programme.desc: Michael Dippolito waived his attorney-client privilege so the lawyer could testify.

programme.title: FL v. Dalia Dippolito
programme.desc: Jurors heard from Michael Dippolito's former attorney, who represented him during the time he was arrested for defrauding investors and grand theft.

programme.title: FL v. Dalia Dippolito
programme.desc: The state argued that the money trail of Michael Dippolito's financial transactions lea him to be the target of his wife's murder plot.

programme.title: FL v. Dalia Dippolito
programme.desc: Michael claimed drugs were planted in his vehicle and his money was stolen.
